p: Another case is T. patula, whose major constituents in the essential oil from leaf, capitula, and total above ground herb collected in regions of India were limonene (6.2–13.6%), ( Z)-[3-ocimene] (0.3–8.3%), dihydrotagetone (4.5–8.1%), terpinolene (0–11.2%), p-cymen-8-ol (3.4–11.0%), piperitone (6.1–11.9%), piperitenone (2.7–8.1%), β-caryophyllene (2.3–8.0%), and trans-sesquisabinene hydrate (2.0–12.5%) [ 27]. Thus, geographical origin plays an important role in the chemical diversity among species and even in the same species [ 21].
